com.ibm.team.scm.client
Interface IWorkspaceConfiguration

public interface IWorkspaceConfiguration

This interface represents a cross-component view of the workspace's configuration. In an effort to reduce round trips for common workspace-wide use cases, this interface provides a subset of functionality of what IConfiguration provides.

Since:
0.6

Method Detail

fetchCompleteItems

java.util.Map fetchCompleteItems(java.util.List components,
                                 java.util.List versionableItemsByComponent,
                                 org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor monitor)
                                 throws TeamRepositoryException
Finds and retrieves the given versionable items in this configuration. It is assumed that these items can be found within the component that scopes this configuration.

The result is a flat list of versionable states that includes elements corresponding to each of the given items, in the same order. Items absent from the configuration are indicated by null in the corresponding position in the result. The operation fails if the client is not logged in to the repository, or the configuration is unavailable for any other reason.

Parameters:
components - a list of components, never null, not empty.
versionableItems - a list of lists of versionable item(element type: IVersionableHandle); must not be null, or contain null lists; this list is considered to be a parallel list to components and must be of the same length
monitor - a progress monitor, or null if progress reporting is not desired
Returns:
a map from component-id to a map of the states of the versionable items (element type: IVersionableor null) by item id, with null entry values indicating corresponding items absent from the configuration (element type: IVersionable; never null
Throws:
NotLoggedInException - if the operation fails because the client was not logged in to the repository
ComponentNotInWorkspaceException - if the operation fails because a specified component is not in the workspace
org.eclipse.core.runtime.OperationCanceledException - if the operation is canceled. Cancellation can occur even if no progress monitor is provided.
TeamRepositoryException - if the operation fails for any other reason

fetchAncestorsByName

java.util.List fetchAncestorsByName(java.lang.String exactVersionableName,
                                    org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor monitor)
                                    throws TeamRepositoryException
Finds and retrieves versionable items in this configuration whose names match the input criteria.

The result is a flat list of versionable states that includes elements corresponding to each of the given items, in the same order. Items absent from the configuration are indicated by null in the corresponding position in the result. The operation fails if the client is not logged in to the repository, or the configuration is unavailable for any other reason.

Parameters:
exactVersionableName - a non-null, non-empty name for the versionable
monitor - a progress monitor, or null if progress reporting is not desired
Returns:
the list of ancestor reports according to states of the versionable items (element type: IComponentizedAncestorList) which match the criteria; never null, but perhaps empty.
Throws:
NotLoggedInException - if the operation fails because the client was not logged in to the repository
org.eclipse.core.runtime.OperationCanceledException - if the operation is canceled. Cancellation can occur even if no progress monitor is provided.
TeamRepositoryException - if the operation fails for any other reason
See Also:
IVersionable.getName()

childEntriesForRoots

java.util.Map childEntriesForRoots(org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor monitor)
                                   throws TeamRepositoryException
Retrieves the names and item handles for the children of the root folder for all configurations in the workspace.

The operation fails if the client is not logged in to the repository, the configuration is unavailable, or the item is not present in this configuration.

Parameters:
monitor - a progress monitor, or null if progress reporting is not desired
Returns:
a map of component item id to a non-null possibly empty map of name-item entries (key type: String, value type: IVersionableHandle); unmodifiable and fixed; the entries all have distinct non-null names; the entries all have distinct non-null item ids and include state ids; the order of the entries is unspecified and may vary from call to call; never null
Throws:
NotLoggedInException - if the operation fails because the client was not logged in to the repository
org.eclipse.core.runtime.OperationCanceledException - if the operation is canceled. Cancellation can occur even if no progress monitor is provided.
ItemNotFoundException - if the workspace is not found
TeamRepositoryException - if the operation fails for any reason
Since:
0.6.1
